item.title: About
item.description: Hi! My name is Qiaohui Lin. I am currently a third-year PhD student in Statistics and Data Sciences at The University of Texas at Austin. I am supervised by Peter Mueller and Purnamrita Sarkar. My research interests lie in Bayesian nonparametrics and network analysis. Previous to UT, I have received my Master’s degree at Duke University and Bachelor’s degree at Fudan, Shanghai.

item.title: Experience
item.description: Applied Scientist at Amazon (Summer Internship 2020) Machine Learning Team on Delivery Experience. Data Scientist at Expedia Group (Summer Internship 2019) Search Team on ranking of Vrbo. Research Assistant at Duke Clinical Research Institution (Summer 2017) Research on clinical noshow prediction.

item.title: Publication
item.description: Conference Paper Lin, Qiaohui., Lunde, Robert., & Sarkar, Purnamrita. (2020). On the Theoretical Properties of the Network Jackknife. ICML 2020 (Thirty-seventh International Conference on Machine Learning). Link to pdf on proceedings.icml.cc. Link to slides Journal Paper Lin, Qiaohui, Betancourt, Brenda, Goldstein, Ben A., & Steorts, Rebecca. C. (2020). Prediction of appointment no-shows using electronic health records. Journal of Applied Statistics, 47(7), 1220-1234. Link to pdf
